text: The Będzin concentration camp was a Nazi concentration camp in the Silesian Voivodeship in southern Poland, located near the city of Będzin. The concentration camp was first established in 1940. Over 20,000 Jews from Będzin, along with an additional 10,000 Jews expelled from other areas where deported there. Category:1940 establishments in Europe Category:1940s establishments in Poland Category:Nazi concentration camps in Poland Category:Silesian Voivodeship
title: Będzin concentration camp
